bioghist.p: Lewis Benson (1906-1986) was a recorded minister in the Religious Society of Friends (Quakers) and is best known for his research and lecturing on the message of George Fox (founder of Quakerism). He was the author of Catholic Quakerism, The Religionless Christianity of George Fox, and Friends and Truth. He was a member of Manasquan, New Jersey, Meeting.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Lewis Benson. Materials include: subject files on monthly and yearly meetings and various Quaker organizations; subject files, notebooks, and notecards on religious topics, particularly the life and writings of George Fox; pamphlets, tracts, newsletters, and printed studies and addresses on Quaker topics; lectures and articles by Benson; correspondence; and travel notebooks of Sarah and Lewis Benson.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
